contextId.information: This can be written in modern measurements. AT: "a fourth part of a liter" or "a quarter of a liter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
contextId.quote: the fourth part of a kab

contextId.information: Here the word "measure" translates the word "seah," which is a unit of dry measurement equal to about 7 liters. AT: "14 liters of barley ... 7 liters of fine flour" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
contextId.quote: two measures of barley ... a measure of fine flour
